name: Cassandra Police Office
description: The local police office of Cassandra, a small-town law enforcement building that includes reception areas, interrogation rooms, a forensic workspace, and internal archives. While modest in size, it serves as the town’s central hub for official records, investigations, and post-incident processing.

snapshot.name: Cassandra Police Office
snapshot.description: The police office consists of a public-facing front area, several offices, a small forensic studio used for basic autopsy and evidence examination, and an internal archive room storing case files, reports, and historical records. The atmosphere is restrained and bureaucratic, with a sense that not all past incidents have been thoroughly resolved.

characters.name: Vito
characters.notes: A good-natured auxiliary officer in his thirties with Latin American heritage. Helpful but not particularly sharp, he follows protocol and defers to superiors.

clues.clueText: Police records documenting TWO SEPARATE MURDER CASES: The FIRST CASE (December 22, 2002) at Paradil Grand Hotel—a 19-year-old Black girl found frozen in ice in the hotel kitchen basement freezer. The SECOND CASE (December 22, 2003) at Reindeer Bar—a 21-year-old Black girl (Aberforth Locefern) killed by gunshot and knife in the restroom. Exactly one year apart.
reveals: Two separate murder cases, exactly one year apart
Different locations (hotel freezer vs bar restroom)
Different methods (frozen in ice vs gunshot/stab)
Bruno attempted to investigate both cases

clues.clueText: Forensic notes for the SECOND CASE indicate the body showed anomalies: gunshot wound (.357 caliber) to the heart and a folding knife in the back. The FIRST CASE notes (if accessible) describe a body completely frozen in ice, completely naked, found in a freezer—completely different circumstances.
reveals: Evidence suggesting unnatural or abnormal causes
Two distinct murder methods suggest possible connection but different execution
The first case was quickly shelved, the second case is under active investigation

clues.clueText: Bruno's case files show he was investigating BOTH cases, recognizing they might be connected despite being exactly one year apart and using different methods.
reveals: Bruno believed the two cases were related
The first case was denied official investigation status
Bruno's determination to solve both cases may have led to his death

conditions.description: Harsh fluorescent lighting in offices and forensic areas.
conditions.mechanicalEffect: Extended research here may cause minor fatigue at Keeper’s discretion

events: Officers moving files between offices and the archive
Routine evidence handling in the forensic studio

exits.description: Public entrance used by civilians and officers

snapshot.keeperNotes: The police office contains records for BOTH MURDER CASES. CRITICALLY DISTINCT: FIRST CASE (December 22, 2002)—19-year-old Black girl, frozen in ice in hotel freezer. SECOND CASE (December 22, 2003)—21-year-old Black girl (Lucifero), gunshot and knife in bar restroom. Exactly one year apart, TWO DIFFERENT BODIES, different methods. Bruno investigated both and believed they were connected. The police office should feel procedural and restrained. Access to sensitive files may require persuasion, authority, or favors. The forensic studio is limited in capability and may overlook non-human explanations. Emphasize the distinction between the two cases when investigators access records.
permanentChanges: Sensitive files removed or flagged after investigator interference
